# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    lines = [words[1]]
    
    current_line_length = length(words[1])
    for i in 2:length(words)
        if current_line_length + length(words[i]) + 1 <= text_width
            lines[end] *= " " * words[i]
            current_line_length += length(words[i]) + 1
        else
            push!(lines, words[i])
            current_line_length = length(words[i])
        end
    end
    
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

Example:
```julia
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed faucibus pharetra volutpat. Vestibulum vestibulum est nec justo semper, a egestas enim aliquet. Morbi mi libero, commodo in tristique sed, scelerisque eu tellus. Sed eu dui non arcu hendrerit fringilla."

wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, 20)
println(wrapped_text)
```
